entry.title: Tramaine de Senna
entry.summary: About the artistTramaine de Senna is an American artist working and living…
entry.content:
About the artist

Tramaine de Senna is an American artist working and living in Antwerp, Belgium. Tramaine’s body of work consists of sculptures in a wide array of colors, materials and techniques. Her interest in issues as the “migration of forms”, pop and material culture, internalized violence, exuberance and the enduring ambiguous presence of histories raise dramatic questions about identity. Follow Tramaine on Instagram to see more of her beautiful and interesting work.

entry.title: Samar Hejazi
entry.summary: About the artistSamar Hejazi is a Palestinian artist working and living in…
entry.content:
About the artist

Samar Hejazi is a Palestinian artist working and living in Toronto, Canada. She explores her heritage and observes the complex conversations between social constructivism, ethnology and the ethos of modernity by using different craft practices. This results in a body of work consisting of different materials, forms and techniques. Follow Samar on Instagram to see more of her delicate and powerful work.

entry.title: David Wilson
entry.summary: About David WilsonDavid Wilson is an American artist working and living in…
entry.content:
About David Wilson

David Wilson is an American artist working and living in Oakland, CA. Under the name Ribbons he creates drawings and paintings of nature and orchestrates site-based gatherings that draw together artists, performers, musicians, chefs, filmmakers and artisans. Find out more about David Wilson’s detailed work here.

entry.title: Simon Tran
entry.summary: About the artistSimon Tran is an artist working and living in Berkeley,…
entry.content:
About the artist

Simon Tran is an artist working and living in Berkeley, CA. As the son of Vietnamese immigrants in the USA he pays tribute to his heritage in his paintings. Through a bold use of colour and abstract shapes and forms he redirects the cultural trauma that was caused by the war and colonialism in Vietnam. In his own words, Simon describes his work as being about reconfiguration, resistance and a hearty bowl of soup. We love it! Follow Simon Tran on Instagram to see more of his vibrant work.

entry.title: Elle Sofe Sara
entry.summary: About the artistElle Sofe Sara is a director and choreographer living and…
entry.content:
About the artist

Elle Sofe Sara is a director and choreographer living and working in Guovdageaidnu, Norway. In her work she sheds light on the social, political and cultural peculiarities and challenges of the Sámi people. For more news about Elle Sofe Sara’s performances follow her on Instagram.

entry.title: Mariam el-Quessny
entry.summary: About the artistMariam el-Quessny is an Egyptian artist and interior designer working…
entry.content:
About the artist

Mariam el-Quessny is an Egyptian artist and interior designer working and living in Oakland, CA. She’s the mom of three children and has been illustrating her and other mothers’ stories about motherhood as a reaction to the often idealised images of motherhood on social media. Follow Mariam or her Motherhood Illustrated Series on Instagram to see more of her beautiful and detailed work.

entry.title: Contact
entry.summary: If you like what you hear, read or see, let us know!…
entry.content:
If you like what you hear, read or see, let us know!

You can reach us at contact@artcrushinternational.com

entry.title: About Us
entry.summary: About the showART CRUSH INTERNATIONAL is a new podcast from textile artist…
entry.content:
About the show

ART CRUSH INTERNATIONAL is a new podcast from textile artist Jozefien Buydens and journalist Svea Vikander. Based in Belgium and Norway respectively, Jozefien and Svea have spent the last three years combing the globe for the world’s most interesting and unusual artist spaces. And now they’re ready to take you with them.

ART CRUSH INTERNATIONAL takes its inspiration from ART CRUSH, a bi-weekly radio show which the two co-hosted on KALX Berkeley. Focusing on artists in the San Francisco Bay Area, ART CRUSH was broadcast by one of the top five college radio stations in the nation. Now, you can hear their too-intimate questioning anytime, anywhere.

 

 

About the hosts

Jozefien Buydens is an art historian and textile designer based in Ghent, Belgium. She is currently adjunct professor at KASK School of Arts Ghent, and spends her free time fantasizing about making her own platform shoes. Find her at www.jozefienbuydens.com or Instagram.

Svea Vikander is a Swedish-Canadian journalist and writer. A former therapist, she is now working on her second graduate degree—this time in journalism. Svea lives in a Sámi community in Arctic Norway and makes a mean reindeer blood pancake. Find her at www.sveavikander.com, on Twitter or Instagram.
